Questions.text: With regard to the correct use of antimicrobials, it can be stated that:

choices.text: When there is no clinical improvement, the dose and duration of treatment should be increased.
Amoxicillin is indicated in the alveolitis.
Anaerobes are not sensitive to metronidazole.
The ideal is to make prescription of the short spectrum.

Questions.text: The chemotherapy listed below most often associated with cardiotoxicity is:

choices.text: Doxorubicin
Cyclosporin
Tacrolimus
Methotrexate

Questions.text: The use of levofloxacin may cause, with low but not negligible frequency:

choices.text: Acute Liver Failure
Irreversible lesion of the vestibular nerve
Torsades de Pointes
Tendonitis and rupture of the Achilles tendon

Questions.text: Drug interaction is a frequent cause of hospital admissions. The nurse must know that the drug interaction between:

choices.text: Contraceptives and rifampicin increases the contraceptive effect
Tetracycline and antacids increase the absorption of tetracycline
Angiotensin and potassium conversion enzyme inhibitors cause abrupt hypokalemia
Anxiolytics and sedatives potentiate the effect of these drugs

Questions.text: Client attended in the outpatient clinic has extrapyramidal syndrome due to excessive ingestion of haloperidol. In this case, the characteristic signs of this syndrome are:

choices.text: Bronchial secretion, kernictero and bradycardia
Agitation, malignant hyperthermia and hypoglycemia
Euphoria, hypothermia and trachoma
Neck stiffness, facial spasms and opisthotonus
